oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Letter for Governor Rye from Henry Ford
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A letter for Governor Rye from Henry Ford regarding the International Conference for Peace. In the letter, Ford asks Governor Rye to join him and other United States government officials to the conference in Copenhagen.

From 1913 to 1924, philanthropist Henry Ford embarked on an international crusade for peace known as the Henry Ford Peace Expedition, with the majority of his work consisting from 1915 to 1916. The purpose of the expedition was to gather delegates from non-combatant countries for the purpose of peace mediation.
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Ford, Henry
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: World War, 1914-1918; World War, 1914-1918 - History; Ford, Henry, 1863-1947; Neutral Conference for Continuous Mediation (1916)
